item.title: Trump says Putin talks 'don't go anywhere' as he imposes new sanctions
item.description: The US has announced new sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil, Russia's two largest oil companies, over continued fighting in Ukraine.

item.title: Ten dead in blast at Russian munitions plant in Urals
item.description: Witnesses describe seeing explosions and a fireball at the Plastmass military plant in Kopeisk.

item.title: Trump says 'existing structure' of White House East Wing to be torn down
item.description: The US president previously said that his $250m (£186m) ballroom addition would not "interfere with the current building".

item.title: EU set to endorse deal to turn frozen Russian assets into support for Ukraine
item.description: The contentious proposal would see Kyiv receive €140bn (£121bn) worth of frozen Russian state assets currently held in Belgium.

item.title: Rubio warns against West Bank annexation after Israel's parliament advances move
item.description: The US Secretary of State says such a step would threaten Washington's plan to end the conflict in Gaza.
